meanings.definition: To make a face or gesture of disgust or disapproval.
meanings.sent1: She was yucking at the sight of the slimy snail.
meanings.sent2: The children were yucking at the taste of the bitter medicine.
meanings.sent3: Even the dog was yucking at the strange smell coming from the garbage can.
meanings.sent4: The idea of eating bugs made her yucking in horror.
meanings.sent5: The yucking expression on his face showed his distaste clearly.

meanings.definition: To express strong dislike or aversion.
meanings.sent1: He kept yucking about the idea of going to the dentist.
meanings.sent2: She was yucking about the thought of eating broccoli.
meanings.sent3: The cat was yucking loudly when presented with the new food.
meanings.sent4: The politician's speech had everyone yucking in disagreement.
meanings.sent5: The yucking comments on the movie review showed the audience's dislike.

meanings.definition: To react with revulsion or distaste.
meanings.sent1: The baby started yucking as soon as the spinach touched his lips.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help yucking when she saw the creepy crawly bug.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's joke had the audience yucking with laughter.
meanings.sent4: The smell coming from the kitchen had everyone yucking in disgust.
meanings.sent5: The yucking reaction on her face showed her immediate distaste.
